org.apache.juneau.rest

Class RestException

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Throwable
      • java.lang.Exception
        • java.lang.RuntimeException
          • org.apache.juneau.rest.RestException
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BadRequest, Conflict, ExpectationFailed, FailedDependency, Forbidden, Gone, HttpVersionNotSupported, InsufficientStorage, InternalServerError, LengthRequired, Locked, LoopDetected, MethodNotAllowed, MisdirectedRequest, NetworkAuthenticationRequired, NotAcceptable, NotExtended, NotFound, NotImplemented, PayloadTooLarge, PreconditionFailed, PreconditionRequired, RangeNotSatisfiable, RequestHeaderFieldsTooLarge, ServiceUnavailable, TooManyRequests, Unauthorized, UnavailableForLegalReasons, UnprocessableEntity, UnsupportedMediaType, UpgradeRequired, UriTooLong, VariantAlsoNegotiates

    public class RestException
extends RuntimeException
    Exception thrown to trigger an error HTTP status.

    REST methods on subclasses of RestServlet can throw this exception to trigger an HTTP status other than the automatically-generated 404, 405, and 500 statuses.

    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • getRootCause

        public Throwable getRootCause()
        Returns the root cause of this exception.

        The root cause is the first exception in the init-cause parent chain that's not one of the following:

        • RestException
        • InvocationTargetException
        Returns:
        The root cause of this exception, or null if no root cause was found.

      • getFullStackMessage

        public String getFullStackMessage(boolean scrubForXssVulnerabilities)
        Returns all error messages from all errors in this stack.

        Typically useful if you want to render all the error messages in the stack, but don't want to render all the stack traces too.

        Parameters:
        scrubForXssVulnerabilities - If true, replaces '<', '>', and '&' characters with spaces.
        Returns:
        All error messages from all errors in this stack.

        public int getOccurrence()
        Returns the number of times this exception occurred on this servlet.
        Returns:
        The occurrence number if @RestResource(useStackTraceHashes) is enabled, or 0 otherwise.
